headline: AST SpaceMobile Provides Business Update and Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: MIDLAND, Texas, November 10, 2025--AST SpaceMobile, Inc. ("AST SpaceMobile") (NASDAQ: ASTS), the company building the first and only space-based cellular broadband network accessible directly by everyday smartphones, and designed for both commercial and government applications, is providing its business update and results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025.

raw.headline: AST SpaceMobile Provides Business Update and Third Quarter 2025 Results

headline: Verizon Sells $11 Billion of Bonds Tied to Frontier Deal
summary: Verizon issued the debt in five parts, according to a person with knowledge of the matter who asked not to be identified discussing private details.  Verizon’s bond offering follows Meta Platforms Inc.’s $30 billion deal last month, the biggest public offering since 2023, and a $25 billion sale from Google parent Alphabet Inc. in US dollars and euros last week.

raw.headline: Verizon Sells $11 Billion of Bonds Tied to Frontier Deal

headline: YouTubers aren’t relying on ad revenue anymore — here’s how some are diversifying
summary: YouTubers are no longer just creators, and in some cases, their side businesses are growing faster than their channels.

headline: JUST Capital Strengthens Board of Directors With Six Strategic Appointments
summary: New Directors to Help Steward the Organization's Mission to Measure and Motivate Responsible Business in an AI-Powered EconomyNew York, NY, Nov. 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- JUST Capital, the leading independent nonprofit on corporate stakeholder performance, today announced the appointment of six new members to its board of directors: Mehdi Ansari (Partner, Sullivan & Cromwell LLP), Jonathan Auerbach (Former EVP and Chief Strategy, Growth & Data Officer, PayPal Holdings Inc.), Laxman Narasimhan

headline: Verizon seeks $10 billion from bond sale to fund Frontier deal, Bloomberg News reports
summary: The wireless carrier filed for a five-part bond sale, earlier in the day, without disclosing a size.⁠ Initial price ‌discussions for the longest portion of the deal, a 40-year bond, ‍are about 1.6 percentage points above Treasuries, the report said.  Verizon did not immediately respond to a Reuters ​request for comment.  It is looking to close its deal for the fiber-optic internet provider early next year, after receiving regulatory ⁠approval in May upon agreeing to ​end its diversity programs.

Verizon did not immediately respond to a Reuters ​request for comment.  It is looking to close its deal for the fiber-optic internet provider early next year, after receiving regulatory ⁠approval in May upon agreeing to ​end its diversity programs.
